explains: n. 分解，溶解；（议会等的）解散；（契约等的）解除；死亡

sentences.en: He stayed on until the dissolution of the firm in 1948.
sentences.cn: 他一直呆到1948年公司解散。

sentences.en: The empty shell of a snail or clam may be left behind, and if it is sufficiently durable and resistant to dissolution, it may remain basically unchanged for a long period of time.
sentences.cn: 蜗牛或蛤蜊的空壳可能会被留下来，如果足够持久和抗溶解，它可能会在很长一段时间内基本保持不变。

sentences.en: There came to him a presentiment of his early dissolution [death].
sentences.cn: 他突然有一种早亡的预感。
